reviews.review:
Sonuna kadar fanatiği olduğum Half-Life serisinin 2. oyunu. Yönettiğimiz bilim adamı olan Gordon Freeman ve sevgilisi levye ile maceralara devam ediyor. 2004 senesine ait oyun fakat Steam'in hela en kaliteli oyunlarından biri. Düzgün fiyatı,harika ses efektleri,muhteşem grafikler ve Half-Life'ı özel kılan Source motoru ve fiziğiyle inanılmaz bir deneyim. Hikayenin sizi film gibi alıp gitmesine bayılıyorsanız bence tam üstüne bastığınız oyun. Her zamanki gibi Half-Life gibi Valve'de sırlarla saklı. Acaba oyunları neden hiç kasmıyor ? İndirmediğim ve gözükmediği halde Türkçe altyazı ve arayüz nereden geldi ? Ve şu si*tiğimin 3. devam oyunu nerede ?
VALVE HALF LIFE 3 PLS

Эта игра меня буквально охватила! Я никогда не играл в Half Life. Я сомнивался в покупке, и думал что в интернете в шутку пишут что ждут 3 часть! Но буквально только включив игру она меня поразила. Для 2004 года это прорыв, а если бы я её запустил когда она вышла то я  бы уссался от счастья! Короч всем рекомендую, 10 фомок из 10!
Half Life 2 is one of the greatest games ever. It has a great backstory, awesome characters, and a lot of action. Buy this game. It will keep you busy while waiting for Half Life 3.

This game...oh my lord. Let's just start with the gameplay. The gameplay is solid for sure, you have objectives that dont pop up on your screen like Halo or CoD rather you need to figure it out dispite the game being a FPS. Using the world around you at your advatntage to dispatch enemies is great too, using explosive barrels, Buzz saw blades, all that jazz. The story is great, it's like Nazi germany but times 1000 with the Combine. You get this feeling of great depression like all hope was lost. Waters being draining, Earth;s natural wild life leaving or dying out. Zen's wildllfe taking over. You have being being taken from their homes and turnedinto Cyborg like soldiers for the Combine. However you can feel the growing love between Gordon and Alyx through out the games. Lastly the music, the soundtrack for this game is very good. While it sounds similar to the Inception's BOOOOAAAAMMM sound, it keeps it more low key in a way and original in it's own right. The use of both electronic style of music plus a classical score keeps it fresh for me. Would I reccomend this game? Yes because this is a classic, a most play for all gamers.

Now I'm Understand Why we need Half - Life 3

9.5 / 10

SO I have finally got round to playing what people refer to as one of the greatest games in histoy. I was looking forward to seeing what the hype was about, and have come to the conclusion that I really just don't get it. Was it a bad game, definitely not. 

People go on about how it was revoluionary in graphics, combat, atmosphere and story. I am not going to compare it to modern games, rather games that came out at the same time or before. Keep in mind that DOom 3 was released 3 months BEFORE Half Life 2, as I will be using this in my discussion.

First off, the combat. This is something that I found to  be a major let down. The guns did not really feel great. The best gun feel as of the time of release (for me) was the single barrel shot gun from Doom. It just had the right kick, and was a pleasure to use. The Sniper rifle from Unreal Tournament, another gun that just felt satisfying, regardless of whether it was a head shot or not. 
What the combat did do right was AI. The AI in this game is awesome, and the different enemy types were very varied in how you would deal with them. The use of physics objects to change their pathing was definitely something that kept the game interesting.

Now I will move onto graphics. The graphics for the time were definitely good. No two ways about that, they even hold up ok today. But compare this to Doom 3, where many people for many years after release were not able to run the game on full settings, I find the graphics in Doom 3 to be extremely well done, even by todays standards, you can still happily enter and see reflections, blood splatters that don't look aweful, amazing lighting, etc. Half Life 2 had the advantage of showing off with large spaces, but Doom 3 excelled in regards to the fine detail.

Atmosphere is something Half Life 2 nailed pretty well. Again I compare to Doom 3, where the atmosphere was also exactly how I expect the developers wanted. You felt like you could be jumped at any second, the lighting flickering was great, etc. Half Life 2, again being a more open game, did its job rather well in making the world feel large, and the city feel alive. The numerous NPC's scattered around the place really gave a sense of survival under opression.

Now finally, the story. I can see that this story could have been amazing. But none of it is really explained at any point. And whether that is a quirk of the series, or whatever it is meant to be passed off as, it prevents me from caring about what it is that I am doing. I keep going to places because I am told to. I felt nothing for any of the characters, and this could come down to the silent protagonist. I personally am not a fan of that in story telling as it jsut doesn't give me a sense of what the main character is thinking. And as for the administrator, I have no idea who this guy is and what his role is, or whether or not I should take up some offer that he makes, because there is absolutely nothing to give away what he is offering. A lot fo the dialog just feels like filler to me, without ever really driving the story forward. And then there is G Man... Again, story really looks like it could have been absolutely incredible, but this is only really hinted at,

Two things I found really annoying: 

- The vehicles: The implementation of the vehicles was infuriating. I could not believe how poor they were to control. I've used them plenty in Gary's Mod, and hoped that Half Life 2 would have some better control for them, or less "realistic physics". Honestly, going for game play is a much better idea, because that will lead to fun. Going for physics is a gamble, and might be interesting for a short time, but wears down quickly, especailly when there doesn't feel like there is any weight to the thing you are driving. Seriously feels like I was flying around ina  tissue box in the air boat, not a large metal thing.

- Trying to figure out where the hell to go: On numerous occasions, there is someone calling out to you, or someone says "go to X" (seriously,m get to the horse was one of the worst ones). You are then looking around trying to figure out how to get somewhere after you have identified the destination. Now it would be more acceptable if it was some form of physics puzzle, but trying to find a tiny little beam that goes in theopposite direction from the objective, and leads to a little ledge really isn't good enough indication.

Other than some of the destination finding, the map design was really quite good. The environments felt large, and even the vehicle sections that I didn't like had good map design for the purpose they needed to fulfill. Ravenholm was really a brilliant map, and was a pleasure to work my through, both horizontally and vertically. Really, really good job on that one. Not really sure that there was a problem with any of the maps, most of them were of very good quality.

SO, in closing, i finished the game in around 9 hours, and that is about it. I am neutral on the matter. It had some cool features, mainly the AI and some of the physics, and it had some really poor ones, like the vehicle control and the trying to figure out where you are going.

I'd give it a 7/10. Get it, but don't expect one of the greatest games, expect a decent FPS with some neat tricks.

Et si vous connaisser Garry's mod, vous connaitrez ainsi la naissance du physigun, meme si dans Gmod, le physigun est un peu différent dans son fonctionnement. Voila, j'aime beaucoup ce jeu et je le recommande de tout mon coeur. 9,9/10

Tardé bastante en poder jugarlo porque era cuando Steam empezaba y, aunque tenía el juego, no tenía internet y eso me mataba porque la primera parte había sido increíble y estuvimos mucho tiempo esperando esta secuela. Pero cuando lo jugué por fin, las expectativas se hicieron realidad.

Continúa la trama desatada en la primera parte con otra historia de ciencia ficción y acción digna de una película que se está haciendo tanto de rogar como la tercera parte, pero que bien mirado no haría falta porque el juego ya es una película en sí. Pero no una película interactiva en la que a veces disparas, no. Al igual que en el primero, todo sucede a tiempo real y en pleno juego, sin secuencias cinemáticas ni nada que interrumpa lo que al fin y al cabo hemos venido a hacer aquí que es jugar. Jugar a ser Gordon Freeman en un mundo que cae en pedazos a nuestro alrededor.

Hazte de él sí o sí con los episodios 1 y 2, ya que son las continuaciones directas.

[h1]"Проснитесь и пойте, Гордон Фримен!"[/h1]
Шесть лет назад мы покинули Гордона Фримена в темном вагоне метро, сделав выбор, навеки изменивший всю его жизнь. Физик, показавший миру, каким бывает настоящий «киношный» шутер, вернулся без объяснений, молча ступил на вокзальный перрон и с головой окунулся в обшарпанную реальность постсоветского тоталитаризма. На мой взгляд, в игре отчётливо показали весь страх людей перед этой формой правления, и именно поэтому должен был прийти герой- Гордон Фримен! Именно поэтому G-man пробуждает Гордона Фримена из стазиса и перемещает в поезд, идущий в Сити 17, город в Восточной Европе.

Тесные дворики поздней «сталинской» застройки с насквозь проржавевшими качелями, клочья грязно-желтой краски на стенах, поросшая бурьяном окружная железная дорога, бесхозные «Жигули» в пустынных тоннелях и ощерившаяся трубами промзона… Здесь царит дух оруэлловщины, в глазах рябит от фотовспышек вездесущих сканеров, а с гигантских экранов льется классический душ для мозгов.

City 17, коллективный портрет всей Восточной Европы, променял социализм на иго пришельцев из соседнего измерения. Где бы вы ни были, отовсюду видна Цитадель. Эта массивная, внушающая благоговение стела, чей шпиль теряется в стратосфере, не просто возвышается над миром; она растет, ежечасно подминая под себя кварталы и улицы уродливыми металлическими ступнями.

Valve сменила низкие потолки лабораторий «Black Mesa„ на пейзажи под открытым небом, оставив в неприкосновенности идею замкнутого пространства. На протяжении четырнадцати глав мы гуляем по канализации, заброшенным заводам, кладбищу кораблей на берегу обмелевшего моря, полуразрушенным “спальникам», тюремным застенкам и мрачной, почти готической деревушке Рейвенхолм, но в итоге все равно возвращаемся на привокзальную площадь, дабы увидеть, как огромное лицо злого доктора Брина разбивается о восхитительно выпуклую брусчатку.
Вот и я заканчиваю свою рецензию и на последок хочется сказать, Гейб- ГДЕ МОЯ ХАЛФА 3!? А?
G맨이 시작부터 까꿍해주는 명작게임이다. 그것도 그래픽이 더 좋아져서 돌아왔다. 그냥 짧게 말하면 잼슴. 하지만 재밌는 만큼 어렵다. 특히 레이븐홈.

It was one of those troublesome weeks for finding something to review, the habitual drunkard that is the release schedule: belched up the last of its’ latest round of rancid gut butter and has rolled over and gone back to sleep as we awkwardly hold the bucket and wait for the next tremulous stomach gurgle like a nest of baby birds.

I was gonna do Pillars of Eternity, but after I rolled a character and went through the prologue, I walked out into a meadow and was immediately slaughtered by a small group of wild piglets, I’m not sure I’m on the right wavelength for that kind of game, although I did start enjoying myself later when I was reading through some conversational text and was suddenly magically transported to a dark thorny forest, full of gigantic monster crabs. But then I realised that I’d actually fallen asleep from boredom and my face was resting on a 1970’s issue of Mayfair.  

So instead, let’s do what I usually do when current releases are letting me down Let’s Get Ret...Ro. After all you can’t polish a turd but you can at least reminisce about the lovely pie and chips it used to be. It’s not hard to find relevant retro games since remakes, remasters and updates are constantly raining down upon us like someone planted landmines in the graveyard. 

Half Life 2 was recently updated with the imaginatively-titled Half Life 2: Update, a community-made mod that improves the graphics in such a way that you probably wouldn't notice without a side-by-side comparison. But hey, graphics are like public toilet cleaners: you know they’re doing their job properly if you never notice or think about them. The update also adds commentary not by the original developers but by quote, "members of the Half Life community". And forgive me if that feels a little presumptuous. Bob the stinky tramp is technically a member of the community, but I wouldn't ask him his opinions on local government. The thing about fan commentary is that it’s pretty-much always going to be cheer-leading 'cause that’s what defines a fan, whereas the developer ten years down the line might actually have some self-criticism with the benefit of hindsight. 99% of creators claim to loathe everything they made more than five years ago and the remaining 1% are liars.

So with the occasion of the update,let’s see if Half Life 2 still holds up, Half Life one did the last time we rode the retro metro, but Half Life 2 isn't quite the same vent full of Space Crabs.

 After escaping the research facility and after defeating the leader of the alien invasion in Half Life one, Gordon Freeman has a well-deserved lie-in for the next twenty years before finding the earth he fought so hard to save double-backsy reconquered by an even WORSE alien race, and the struggling human resistance now considers him to be speccy Jesus. God knows why, when none of them actually saw him blow up the alien leader and most of the rest of Half Life one was spent gunning down American serviceman and failing to rescue scientists. Also, the leaders of the Earth resistance all used to work with Gordon at Black Mesa, as did the human overseer of the occupying aliens, which is the kind of extraordinary coincidence that could only be explained by writers trying to force continuity between what could have easily been two completely unconnected plots. But I suppose it wouldn't have been the same without Gordon Freeman, it’s not like players would have accepted any other mute personality-deficient goof, allegedly lurking behind the first-person camera.

Old games that in their day sold themselves on ground-breaking tech usually now come across as kind of quaint at best. Kind of Quake II at worst. Half Life 2 (Surely it would be a Full Life, then?) was most noticeable for its ground breaking physics engine, and if there’s a single word that summarizes its approach to physics it would be “Tadaaaa!”

In this day and age when physics engines are just another old toy cluttering up the playroom of the most hideously-spoiled child to have ever existed, improved physics engines are that where everything doesn't feel like it’s made of vulcanized rubber and characters don’t ragdollise like their bodies  have spontaneously transformed into over-cooked pasta. One might reasonably wonder why we have to pause in the middle of a daring escape through enemy-infested tunnels to pile some bricks onto a see-saw and jump off it onto a ledge when we could just do a single pull-up. The exciting airboat chase has to break flow three or four times because we have to disembark and figure out a Rube-Goldberg machine someone set up to activate a ramp, that could've quite easily been constructed by two planks and a fat person. And the other new tech the game is very keen to showcase like a weirdly chippy roommate humming and skipping round the house desperately hoping you’ll ask how his date went last night is facial animation. To that end we’re occasionally locked in a room for lengthy story sessions that just barely escape being tarred with the cutscene brush ‘cause we’re still free to climb on the furniture and jump on people. Certainly the facial animation is good, the characters are well-rounded but there’s something kind of off about them, maybe it’s the way they remain so weirdly chipper, while the oppressive regime is murdering people next door, or how their enthusiasm never wavers no matter how many times Gordon never speaks or visibly reacts. 

This was fine in Half Life one when the cast consisted of ninety-thousand clones of the same five guys, but when there’s an emphasis on individual characters and their interactions, the silent protagonist feels weirdly out of place in the middle of it. It feels like everyone’s acting at him y’know what I mean? Like he’s a casting director at a restaurant and they’re a waiter with big ambitions. But now that faces rarely need to animate much beyond a grim, determined-frown and physics engines are largely used to make bits of grit realistically fly off of chest-high walls, don’t you think the wonder and creative spirit that tech was intended to provoke has been lost? It wasn't just that Half Life: 2 Episode: 0 had physics it was that the gameplay made it work! The whole game is a series of showcase set-pieces linearly strung together, but at least it had something to showcase. Most action games have physics engines now but precious few have a mechanic as simple and gratifying as the Gravity Gun to use the physics to its’ full potential and give the world a sense of true interactivity. Many admittedly have better endings where the story doesn't just screech abruptly to a halt because its run out of set-pieces, with two more episodes bolted on after the facts that end on a cliffhanger that goes unresolved forever, thus earning a permanent benefit of the doubt. Well fucking played Valve. 

Is Half Life 3 taking so long ‘cause you need to think of another innovative thing to showcase in it? Why not start with a ladder that it’s possible to detach from without breaking both your legs!? - Yahtzee

The best of the decade.

You always hear about Half-Life 2 and the claim that it is one of the best video games to date. I decided it was time to adventure through this game and see what the fuss was all about. This game is incredible in just about every aspect. Story was great and the gravity gun caused for some hell of a good time. Enjoyable tossing a saw blade through the air to slice people in half. Sadly I didn't play the original Half-Life so I was a bit confused with the story at first, a recap or something would of been nice to give the player a chance to soak in everything that happened previously. After reading a article on Half Life it made alot more sense. For a first person shooter this game had a crap ton of jump scares and points to make me gasp. Turning around to have a headcrab naw into your face or a fast moving zombie jump at you. The amount of shotgun shells wasted in fear
Good Points: Gravity Gun.How well you could interact with the environment.
Bad Points: Where was that romance with Alyx >.>

Story: 9 / 10

Entertainment: 9 / 10
Controls: 10 / 10

Final Grade: A

Tja, was soll man hierzu noch sagen außer dass es ein herausragend großartiges Spiel ist?
Ich denke dazu gibt es auch nicht mehr viel zu sagen. So muss ein wegweisender shooter aussehen!
Grafik: Für die damalige Zeit sehr gut (für die heutige zeit immer noch gut)
Physik: sehr gut
Gameplay: sehr gut
Abwechslung: Großartig viel
Story: Für einen Shooter sehr gut
Und mit so einer großen Mod Community wird dieses Spiel niemals aussterben.

Fazit: Klare Kaufempfehlung für jeden! Selbst für die, denen so ein Genre normalerweise nicht liegt. :)
